data.title: Price is slowly going up
data.text: I love double front chicken plate with fries and pickles.  Double Front has been a Missoula mainstay since I was a kid 40+ years ago. We rarely ate in but it's an option. Mostly we'd order take out. The meals have gotten smaller and price just keeps going up. But love it

data.title: Mmmm. Fried Chicken!
data.text:
On a long road trip, we usually try to get one meal out a day at a local restaurant along the way. The Double Front Cafe had great reviews, so we decided that we would stop there.  Oddly enough, we had trouble finding it, due to the fact that there were no cars parked on the street and trees covered the big sign.  Turns out we were parked right in front of it, and we were only the second group of the lunch crowd.  And it did fill up right after we got our meal!

This is a small shop, and you can't be in a big hurry.  We never eat friend chicken, but the reviews were so good that we gave it a try.  What a treat!  Crispy and flavorful, we gobbled it up.  Now the really nice thing about it is that it wasn't greasy, nor did it "sit in our stomachs" like so much fried food does.  That was a huge plus, because we still had a long drive ahead of us!  And the iced tea was fresh-brewed and lovely, too.

data.title: Great fried chicken
data.text: I like this place but my husband loves it. We visit Missoula once a year while visiting family. My. husband says they have the best fried chicken. I tried a grilled chicken sandwich this time and it was very good.

data.title: Tradition!
data.text: Enter off either street, thus, Double Front. Service is slow because everything is made from scratch so it is well worth it. Dark bar downstairs that serves excellent drinks. Highly recommend Double Front as it's nothing fancy but best chicken in forever!

data.title: Patience for the fried chicken
data.text:
The history of Double Front was not always a chicken restaurant and is actually over 100 years old.  Per the website: 

The Double Front was built in 1909, with no alley or back door and so was properly named with a front door at 122 Alder St. and another at 121 Railroad St. In the early years between 1909 and 1920, the building was used mostly as a pool hall. 

After 1920, during prohibition days, the building became a residence and rumor has it some bootlegging may have occurred. In 1934 and 1935 when beer and wine became legal again, the residence changed to a bar and was owned by the Mangan family. It was that year that chicken was first served at the Double Front. 

Managers over the years included Elmer Shea in 1948 and George Austin in 1952. After an auto accident which took Mr. Austin's life in 1959, the Double Front was run by the estate until 1961, at which time the Herndon family bought the cafe and started remodeling the building. Although big changes in appearance have taken place over the years, the quality of our chicken has remained the same. All chicken is cooked to order, and it's always fresh, never frozen...because the best takes a little longer - just as it did in 1935!

As posted, the chicken was cooked to order, and it actually took longer than they anticipated.  For our troubles, the waitress said we were being offered an appetizer on the house.  We told her to suggest something, and she said their breaded fried mushrooms were popular.

The mushrooms were fantastic, and so was the chicken. It was definitely worth the wait.  We ordered the white meat chicken dinner, which was 2 whole breasts, with the wing attached, fries and pickles for $13.00.  Stephen and I decided to share the dinner, and we added a side order of cole slaw for $3.00.  There's no sales tax in Montana, I guess.  Our meal with 2 beers and a diet coke came to just $24.50! Wow, what a bargain.

data.title: Better than Kentucky ...
data.text: Absolutely great fried chicken. We really enjoy the food from here on the times that we get back to Missoula.

data.title: Chicken is still good but not fries
data.text:
The old style chicken is still very tasty. The fries were not good.  Coleslaw was not homemade any more.  It was disappointing.  
The prices were higher than expected.  Service was so so.  
My friend had deep fried gizzards,  and was throwing up all night after not sure what made her sick.

data.title: Hometown Favorite
data.text: I've tried chicken in many many, many places and the Double Front's chicken is by far the best.  The locals  (I am a "semi"-local) love this place--specifically for the chicken.  The restaurant does serve some other meals, but it is a rarity that you see someone eating anything else.  The restaurant has been in operation for decades--barring a brief period of rebuild after a fire (I think in the early 80's) and the chicken has maintained its excellence.  If you will be dining in, either call in your order in advance or be prepared to wait for about 1/2 hour (or longer if it is very busy--as it often is) as the chicken is cooked by order, not in advance, and takes about 30 minutes to prepare.

data.title: Great Fried Chicken spot.
data.text: Store-front restaurant on Alder St. with a bar located in the basement (so no noise when eating). Small menu featuring maybe 10 sandwiches and 4 seafood selections, but people don’t come here for hamburgers. Their mainstay is their fried chicken, served as: Regular – 1/2 of a chicken, All White – 2 breasts & 2 wings (also available as a half order), All Dark – 2 legs & 2 thighs (also available as a half order), or Chicken Tenders. I had the half order of dark and it was cooked perfectly (prepared when ordered so a 15-20 minute wait if not too busy). Nice and crispy skin with a good seasoning. Served with seasoned fries and pickle slices. There are a couple of upgrade on the sides for a small price. If you’re passing through town and have a hankering for some good fried chicken give them a try.

data.title: Simply good fried chicken
data.text: This place was recommended by locals who have been coming for years. Be aware that it could take 40 minutes to get your order brought to the table; but this is a good thing, as everything is freshly cooked or should I say fried. I also heard the chickens are never frozen. I had half order of white meat and it was moist and very good tasting. My friend also had half an order of the dark meat and also enjoyed. I paid 20 bucks for both meals including one beer.

data.title: Best chicken ever!
data.text: Been going to Double Front for years. I must say it is an experience. When you get there they tell you right upfront your order will be 30 minutes. All the chicken is local and has never been frozen. Well worth the 30 minute wait, my favorite is the dark meat meal. My  wife loves the white meat meal. We always get mushrooms on the side which are cooked to perfection. We must stop if you're in Missoula Montana. You will not be disappointed by Double Front.

data.title: Go if you want chicken only
data.text: No atmosphere. Definitely not a trendy place or a place for a salad and glass of wine. Wish we would have gone next door to Rattlesnake distillery for a salad.

data.title: Best fried chicken ever!
data.text: Double front chicken provides the freshest fried chicken you will ever taste.  Portion are quite large so keep that in mind when you order.

data.title: Best Chicken Ever!
data.text: One of the things we miss about our home town is Double Front chicken.  We have been fortunate enough to travel quite a bit and have NEVER found better fried chicken.  A great down home cafe with down home workers.  Keep up the good work!

data.title: Great food for a lot of years..
data.text: Not much selection but if a good deep fry is what is calling you, this is a great place!  I always have the dark meat basket..juicy and tasty!  Weight Watchers it ain't but you are on vacation so what the hell!

data.title: Great chicken
data.text: We are a family of four and bought three meals but could have been full with two dinners. We also bought gizzards bit would skip those. Not so great like the chicken and fries. Those are awesome. We called in the order and had a drink at James bar which was yummy.

data.title: Great to go.
data.text: Great chicken to go. You can call ahead and have your dinner waiting for you. They do have seating down stairs, but take it home. The basic chicken dinner is good for two meals. Enjoy

data.title: Best Chicken in the world
data.text: You can't forget this place on your visit to Missoula. You have to experience i to believe it. I have been eating it for over 50 years. Never disappoints. Friends ship it bck to LA. Might even be a reason to go to Missoula, even if you don't know anybody there.

data.title: If you want fried chicken, this is the place to go.
data.text:
Forget all about the Colonel, this is then real thing...
  I have been eating here off and on for over 40 years.  Still owned by the Herndon family, who started the place back I think in the 30's.  As a disclaimer I have known the Herndons for about 30 years.

They do have a few other things on the menu, but if you want burgers get them elsewhere.  This place does chicken, and they do it well.

No it's not "Southern Style" whatever that is.  The chicken is delivered fresh daily, never frozen, breaded with a secret recipe and deep fried in pure vegetable oil which is changed daily.  For what you get the meal is a real deal, and you won't find better chicken anywhere in Montana, and maybe not anywhere north of the Mason-Dixon line.  

You can get a half chicken, or just the dark half or the white meat half.  You can get a half order of either white or dark meat.  With fries of course, and salad if you want.  The chicken is cooked to order only and takes 25-30 minutes.  Alcoholic beverages are available, there is a full bar in the basement.

Seating is a bit limited, but they do a huge takleout business.  Call your order in in advance.  

I wish I could eat their chicken more often, but the doctor says to stay away from all that sort of stuff.  It's hell to get old.

data.title: BEST FRIED CHICKEN EVER
data.text: best fried chicken anywhere - this is the place I suggest people go if they only get to visit Missoula once - it's ALWAYS perfect - the fries are incredible and the service is wonderful -
